medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent episodes of fever, cough, diarrhea, and failure to thrive in a 2-month-old boy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 2 months of age, characterized by fever, cough, diarrhea, and failure to thrive. These were persistent, and upon admission, supportive care did not improve his condition. After 20 days, he developed mild pancytopenia and elevated liver enzymes indicative of hemophagocytic syndrome (HPS).
medical_history.past_medical_history: X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency (X-SCID) due to a mutation in the IL2RG gene.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother is heterozygous for the same mutation associated with X-SCID; no mutation detected in the patient's father.
